{"step_by_step_thinking": "Post-neonatal mortality refers to deaths that occur between 28 days and 1 year of life. According to Document 21, the major contributors to post-neonatal death are malnutrition, infectious disease, troubled pregnancy, and Sudden Infant Death Syndrome. Document 15 also mentions that the major causes of post-neonatal death are infections and sepsis. None of the documents specifically mention genetic causes, maternal health during pregnancy, environmental causes, or conditions affecting the early neonatal period as the most common cause of post-neonatal mortality.", "answer_choice": "C. Environmental causes"}
